variable.name: certAttr
variable.help:
List of attributes from a client-side certificate. certAttr may include the following components of an X.509 Distinguished Name: C, ST, L, O, OU, CN, title, initials, GN, SN, description, UI, or emailAddress.
Use this variable to check that the user has a client-side certificate with the value(s) specified.

variable.name: certAttr.altName
variable.help:
List of attributes from a client-side certificate. certAttr.altName may include the following components of an X.509 Distinguished Name: directoryName, Email, DNS, URI, ipAddress, and registeredId.
Use this variable to check that the user has a client-side certificate with the value(s) specified.

variable.name: certAttr.serialNumber
variable.help:
Client certificate serial number.
Note that all characters other than [0-9 a-f A-F] are stripped out of a string before comparison with certAttr.serialNumber. Wildcards are not supported.

variable.name: certDN
variable.help: Client certificate subject DN. Wildcard matching is not supported.

variable.name: certDN.<subject-attr>
variable.help: Any variable from the client certificate subject DN, where subject-attr is the name of the RDN key.

variable.name: certDNText
variable.help: Client certificate user DN formatted as a string. Only string comparisons to this value are allowed. Wildcard matching is supported.

variable.name: certIssuerDN
variable.help: Client certificate-issuer subject DN. This variable works like a standard DN attribute such as CertDN. Wild card matching is not supported.

variable.name: certIssuerDN.<issuer-attr>
variable.help: Any variable from the client certificate-issuer subject DN, where issuer-attr is the name of the RDN key.

variable.name: certIssuerDNText
variable.help: Client certificate-issuer subject DN formatted as a string. Only string comparisons to this value are allowed. Wild card matching is supported.

variable.name: certVerify
variable.help: Client certificate verification status. "NONE" means no client certificate is presented.

variable.name: defaultNTDomain
variable.help: If AD/NT authentication is used, then defaultNTDomain contains the Domain value set in the Local authentication server configuration.

variable.name: group.<group-name>
variable.help: Group names from the authorization server catalog. The user is a member of the group variables that are true.

variable.name: groups
variable.help:
List of groups as provided by the realm authentication or directory server.

Note: You can enter any character in the groupname, although wildcard characters are not supported.

variable.name: hostCheckerPolicy
variable.help: Host Checker policies that the client has met.

variable.name: loginHost
variable.help: Host name or IP address of the browser used to contact the device.

variable.name: loginTime
variable.help: The time of day at which the user submits his credentials to the device. The time is based on the device's clock.

variable.name: loginTime.day
variable.help: The numeric day on which the user submits his credentials to the device, where day is 1-31. The time is based on the device's clock.

variable.name: loginTime.dayOfWeek
variable.help:
The day of the week on which the user submits his credentials to the device, where dayOfWeek can be set to [0-6] where 0 = Sunday.
Symbolic values may be used: Sun, Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat

variable.name: loginTime.dayOfYear
variable.help: The numeric day of the year on which the user submits his credentials to the device, where dayOfYear can be set to [0-365].

variable.name: loginTime.month
variable.help: The month in which the user submits his credentials to the device, where month can be set to [1-12] where 1 = January.

variable.name: loginTime.year
variable.help: The year in which the user submits his credentials to the device, where year can be set to [1900-2999].

variable.name: loginURL
variable.help: URL of the page that the user accessed to sign in to the device. The device gets this value from the Administrator URLs/User URLs column on the Authentication > Sign-in Policies page of the Web console. Note: a star ('*') in the sign-in policy URL can be matched by surrounding it with square brackets ('[*]') in the expression.

variable.name: networkIf
variable.help: The network interface on which the user request is received. Possible values: internal, external, management

variable.name: ntdomain
variable.help: If AD/NT authentication is used, then ntdomain contains the domain name part of the user name. The ntdomain variable is always lower-case.

variable.name: ntuser
variable.help: If AD/NT authentication is used, then ntuser contains the user name part of the user name.

variable.name: sourceIp
variable.help:
The IP address of the machine on which the user authenticates.
Caveat: In the resource policy, netmask can be specified using the bit number or in the netmask format '255.255.0.0'

variable.name: time
variable.help: The time of day at which the role mapping rule or resource policy rule is evaluated. The time of the day can be in 12-hour or 24-hour format.

variable.name: time.day
variable.help: The current day of month, where day is 1-31. The time is based on the device's clock.

variable.name: time.dayOfWeek
variable.help:
The day of the week on which the role mapping rule or resource policy rule is evaluated.
Numeric values may be used: [0-6] where 0 = Sunday.
Symbolic values may be used: Sun, Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat

variable.name: time.dayOfYear
variable.help:
The day of the year on which the role mapping rule or resource policy rule is evaluated.
Possible values are: 1-365.

variable.name: time.month
variable.help:
The month in which the role mapping rule or resource policy rule is evaluated.
Possible values are: 1-12

variable.name: time.year
variable.help: The year in which the role mapping rule or resource policy rule is evaluated, where year can be set to [1900-2999].

variable.name: user
variable.help: User name. The user variable will include a domain name if AD/NT authentication is used.

variable.name: userAgent
variable.help: The browser's user agent string.

variable.name: userAttr.<auth-attr>
variable.help: User attributes retrieved from an LDAP or RADIUS server.

variable.name: userDN
variable.help: The user DN from an LDAP server. If the user is authenticated by the LDAP server, then this DN is from the authentication server; otherwise, the DN comes from the realm's Directory/Attribute server.

variable.name: userDN.<user-attr>
variable.help: Any variable from the user DN, where user-attr is the name of the RDN key.

variable.name: userDNText
variable.help: User DN stored as a string. Only string comparisons to this value are allowed.

variable.name: userName
variable.help: User name excluding domain name. The userName variable will always be just the user name excluding any AD/NT domain name.

variable.name: idp.timeStamp
variable.help: Timestamp of the packet

variable.name: idp.severity
variable.help: Severity of the packet

variable.name: idp.srcAddr
variable.help: Source IP Address

variable.name: idp.srcPort
variable.help: Source Port

variable.name: idp.dstAddr
variable.help: Destination IP Address

variable.name: idp.dstPort
variable.help: Destination Port

variable.name: idp.policyVersion
variable.help: IDP Policy Version

variable.name: idp.protocol
variable.help: Protocol of the packet

variable.name: idp.action
variable.help: Action performed by the IDP

variable.name: idp.category
variable.help: Category of the packet

variable.name: idp.attackStr
variable.help: Attack String

variable.name: idp.policyStr
variable.help: IDP Policy String

variable.name: idp.rulebaseStr
variable.help: IDP Rulebase String

variable.name: idp.rulebaseType
variable.help: IDP Rulebase Type String

variable.name: ifmap.name
variable.help: Name of the event

variable.name: ifmap.event_recorded_time
variable.help: Time the event was recorded

variable.name: ifmap.magnitude
variable.help: Indicates how widespread the effects of this event are. Magnitude ranges from 0 to 100.

variable.name: ifmap.confidence
variable.help: Confidence in the event between 0 and 100

variable.name: ifmap.significance
variable.help: Significance of the event: critical, important, or informational

variable.name: ifmap.type
variable.help: Type of the event: p2p, cve, botnet infection, worm infection, excessive flows, behavioral change, policy violation, or other

variable.name: ifmap.other_type_definition
variable.help: Additional type information about an event whose type is "other"

variable.name: ifmap.information
variable.help: Human-readable information about the event

variable.name: ifmap.vulnerability_uri
variable.help: Used for events of type cve to indicate which vulnerability was detected.

filter.name: WELF-SRC-2.0-Access-Report
filter.query: id = ('WEB20174' or 'EML20825' or 'FBR20512' or 'FBR20503' or 'FBR20501' or 'FBR20536' or 'FBR20540' or 'JAV20023' or 'NWC23464' or 'NWC23465' or 'MTG20742' or 'MTG20749' or 'MTG20866' or 'MTG20869' or 'MTG20875' or 'MTG20877' or 'STA22721')

general.description: This policy exports all Network Connect, Junos Pulse and IKEv2 user sessions

standard.instructions: Please sign in to begin your secure session.
standard.signin-again: Click here to sign in again
standard.missing-cert-message: Missing certificate. Check that your certificate is valid and up-to-date, and try again.
standard.invalid-cert-message: Invalid or expired certificate. Check that your certificate is valid and up-to-date, and try again.
standard.pre-authentication-signin-notification-d: You are not allowed to sign in to the system.
standard.post-authentication-signin-notification-: You are not allowed to sign in to the system. Your sign-in has been canceled.

standard.instructions: Please sign in to join your secure meeting.

overview.description: This is the main administrator policy, allowing admins to manage all aspects of the device.
This role allows admins to view all aspects of the device while being able to change nothing.

web-acl.name: Initial Open Policy
web-acl.description: Allows all web browsing! Remove to restrict access to web resources.

sso-basic-ntlm-kerberos.name: Initial Basic Auth Policy
sso-basic-ntlm-kerberos.description: Enable Basic Auth Intermediation! with no SSO.

activex-param.description: Special ActiveX control for Microsoft OWA

file-win-acl.name: Initial File Browsing Policy
file-win-acl.description: Allows all file browsing! Remove to restrict access to file resources.

network-connect-acl.name: Initial Network Connect Policy
network-connect-acl.description: Allows all nework connect! Remove to restrict access.

connection-set.name: Default
connection-set.description: Default Junos Pulse client connection set

option.name: Allow saving logon information
option.description: Enables the Save settings checkbox in the certificate trust and password prompts.

option.name: Allow user connections
option.description: Allows user to create connections via the Pulse UI.

option.name: Dynamic certificate trust
option.description: Controls whether users may accept to trust unknown certificates.

option.name: Dynamic connections
option.description: Allows connections to be deployed automatically from devices.

option.name: Wireless suppression
option.description: Disconnect all wireless interfaces when a wired interface gets connected to a network. Applies to all wireless connections (not just those managed by Pulse).

option.name: URL
option.description: URL of the server. Disable the "This Server" option to enter URL.

option.name: Allow user to override connection policy
option.description: Allows user to modify connection state.

option.name: This Server
option.description: Connection is made to the server which supplied configuration.

component-set.name: Default
component-set.description: Default Junos Pulse client component set
